summary: The bill, the Comprehensive Alternative Response for Emergencies Act of 2025 (CARE Act of 2025), mandates the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation to test a model under the Medicare program. This model, the Comprehensive Alternative Response for Emergencies Model, will provide payment for treatment services furnished by ground ambulance providers when a transport isn't necessary. The bill outlines payment rates, duration (5 years), and requires a report by the Comptroller General on its impact and effectiveness, focusing on beneficiary access, outcomes, and resource utilization.
